text: The 2016–17 Women's FIH Hockey World League Final took place between 17 and 26 November 2017 in Auckland, New Zealand. A total of eight teams competed for the title. The Netherlands won the tournament for a record second time after defeating host nation New Zealand 3–0 in the final match. South Korea won the third place match by defeating England 1–0. ==Qualification== The host nation qualified automatically in addition to 7 teams qualified from the Semifinals. The following eight teams, shown with final pre-tournament rankings, competed in this round of the tournament. {| class=wikitable !Dates !Event !Location !Quotas !Qualifier(s) |- | |colspan=2|Host nation |align=center|1 | (5) |- |21 June – 2 July 2017 |rowspan=2| 2016–17 FIH Hockey World League Semifinals |Brussels, Belgium |rowspan=2 align=center|7 | (1) (8) (9) |- |8–23 July 2017 |Johannesburg, South Africa | (7) (6) (2) (3) |- !colspan="3"|Total !8 !
